'''BNS Abu Bakar''' is a modified [[Type 053H frigate|Type 053H2]] [[frigate]] of the [[Bangladesh Navy]], bought in 2014 from China.
==History== The [[Type 053H frigate|Type 053H2 Frigate]] '''BNS Abu Bakar''' was previously known as '''Huangshi,''' which served with [[People's Liberation Army Navy|People's Liberation Army Navy (PLAN)]] in [[East Sea Fleet]]. She was commissioned in [[People's Liberation Army Navy|PLAN]] in 1986. In 2013 the ship was sold to [[Bangladesh Navy]].
==Career== '''BNS Abu Bakar''' was commissioned to [[Bangladesh Navy]] on 1 March 2014.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://bdnews24.com/bangladesh/2014/03/01/2-modern-warships-commissioned |title=2 Modern Warships Commissioned |work=BDNews24.com |date= |accessdate=31 October 2015}}</ref> She is currently based at [[Chittagong]] under ''Commodore Commanding BN Flotila''.
On April 21–25, 2014, she took part in ''14th Western Pacific Naval Symposium'' and ''International Fleet Review-2014'' in [[Qingdao]], [[Shandong|Shandong Province]] of [[China]]. During the tour, the ship visited the ports of [[Port Klang|Klang]] of [[Malaysia]], [[Hong Kong]], [[Sanya]] of [[China]] and [[Phuket Province|Phuket]] of [[Thailand]] in a goodwill mission.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bssnews.net/newsDetails.php?cat=0&id=409521&date=2014-05-13 |title=Naval ship Abu Bakr returns from China |work=BSSNews.com |date= |accessdate=31 October 2015}}</ref>
On 12 March 2015, the ship left for [[Malaysia]] to take part in [[Langkawi International Maritime and Aerospace Exhibition|Langkawi International Maritime and Aerospace Exhibition (LIMA)]]-2015. On her way back home, she will visit the port of [[Yangon]], [[Burma|Myanmar]] on goodwill mission. She is expected to come back home on 31 March 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/2015/mar/12/bns-abu-bakar-leaves-port-city-lima-2015-malaysia |title=BNS Abu Bakar leaves port city for LIMA-2015 in Malaysia. |work=Dhaka Tribune.com |date= |accessdate=31 October 2015}}</ref>
The ship took part in [[Cooperation Afloat Readiness and Training#CARAT Bangladesh|Cooperation Afloat Readiness and Training(CARAT)]], an annual bilateral exercise with [[United States Navy]], in 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theindependentbd.com/printversion/details/17385 |title=US-Bangla jt exercise begins today |work=Independentbd.com |date=30 September 2015 |accessdate=30 September 2015}}</ref>
She was at the [[Colombo Harbour|port of Colombo]], [[Sri Lanka]] from 21 October to 23,2015 on goodwill visit.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://navaltoday.com/2015/10/23/port-of-colombo-welcomes-bangladesh-naval-ship/ |title=Port of Colombo Welcomes Bangladesh Naval Ship |work=Navaltoday.com |date=22 October 2015 |accessdate=31 October 2015}}</ref>
==Armament== The ship is armed with advanced [[C-802A]] anti-ship missiles with a range of 180 km. It also carries naval guns, anti-aircraft guns, torpedoes and anti-submarine weapons. Recently [[Electronic countermeasure|ECM]] and ''ESSM'' systems are installed on the ship.
